smells.name: MethodOverloading
smells.description: Methods which are overloaded often might be harder to maintain. Furthermore, these methods are tightly coupled. Refactor these methods and try to use optional parameters.

instances.message: This method is overloaded too many times.
This method is overloaded too many times.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function maxDistanceToCorner has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function makeCubicGradientScrimDrawable has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function setViewport has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class GallerySettingsActivity is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class GalleryScanWorker is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

Class Engine is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class LegacySourceService is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class ArtDetailFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

smells.name: ThrowingExceptionsWithoutMessageOrCause

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (ChosenPhoto::class) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ChosenPhoto::class
Parentheses in (Metadata::class) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Metadata::class
Parentheses in (Index(value = ["uri"], unique = true)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Index(value = ["uri"], unique = true)
Parentheses in (Index(value = ["uri"], unique = true)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Index(value = ["uri"], unique = true)
Parentheses in (persistentUri?.toString() != token) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: persistentUri?.toString() != token
Parentheses in (Index(value = ["providerAuthority"])) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Index(value = ["providerAuthority"])
Parentheses in (Artwork::class) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Artwork::class
Parentheses in (Provider::class) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Provider::class

Parentheses in (if (artwork.id != currentArtworkId)
                            DocumentsContract.Document.FLAG_SUPPORTS_DELETE else 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: if (artwork.id != currentArtworkId)
                            DocumentsContract.Document.FLAG_SUPPORTS_DELETE else 0
Parentheses in (Source::class) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Source::class

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.
An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class Source defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: NestedClassesVisibility
